translated: Sikhī, the Kinsman of the World, had attained final Nibbāna,
With a confident and joyful mind,
I went to the funeral pyre;
After making an offering to the funeral pyre,
With a confident and joyful mind,
I returned to my own home.
By that deed, O Leader of the Two-footed,
Best of Men, Best of the World,
I offered flowers to the funeral pyre;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the funeral offering.
had great power and were Wheel-turning Monarchs.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā citakapūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā citakapūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus has it been told.
The Elder Citakapūjaka recited these verses.
